summary: This is a standard Office of the Inspector General (OIG) form used to document warnings and assurances given to a voluntary interviewee. It indicates an OIG investigation is being conducted, and the employee is waiving their rights to provide information voluntarily. No specific details about the Epstein case are present in this boilerplate form text.

persons.name: Q -P.PaI pn
persons.context: The employee's name is handwritten or typed on the form as the person voluntarily agreeing to be interviewed by the OIG.

persons.name: ctor MUM
persons.context: Appears to be the name of the OIG Special Agent conducting the interview, as indicated in the signature block.

connections.description: Special Agent ctor MUM is the investigator interviewing the employee Q -P.PaI pn as part of an OIG investigation.

events.title: OIG Voluntary Interview
events.description: An employee voluntarily agrees to be interviewed by the Office of the Inspector General as part of an investigation.

keyFacts: This is a generic OIG Form III-226/2 used for non-custodial employee interviews.
The form documents that an OIG investigation is being conducted and an employee is providing information voluntarily.
The employee waives certain rights and acknowledges no coercion was used.
The form itself contains no specific details about the subject of the investigation (e.g., Epstein).
The handwritten/typed names on the form are partially obscured or unclear in the provided text.
